text: A truck driver — apparently deliberately — drove into demonstrators in Minneapolis, but no protesters appeared to have been hit, authorities said. The driver has been arrested. https://t.co/ligpPIRYT5

name: chicagotribune
text:
RT @John_Kass: This was a riot. It stopped being about #GeorgeFloyd when the mobs began looting. The shattered glass on Chicago streets like the shards of broken dreams. My latest column for @chicagotribune  #ChicagoRiots 
https://t.co/V6CdF98dtM

text: RT @StacyStClair: The City of Aurora has imposed a 8:30 curfew as looting continues down Main Street. https://t.co/XIhC1HgMqn

name: chicagotribune
text: Police and protesters clashed in downtown Aurora Sunday night after hundreds of people rallied in the city following the death of George Floyd in Minneapolis. Aurora Mayor Richard Irvin has imposed a curfew. https://t.co/jKUBymQp4m

text: Protests and unrest are again unfolding in Chicago but also in the suburbs tonight. Here are the latest developments. https://t.co/LJq0s7Ib1m

text: Secret Service agents rushed President Trump to a White House bunker on Friday night as hundreds of protesters gathered outside the Executive Mansion, some of them throwing rocks and tugging at police barricades. https://t.co/pTGoeQ73XM

text: As Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot requested the Illinois National Guard be brought in to prevent a second night of downtown violence and looting, the chaos spilled into some city neighborhoods and suburban towns. https://t.co/sbXRJCWEPr

name: chicagotribune
text: Tens of thousands of protesters took to the streets across America again Sunday, with peaceful demonstrations against police killings of black people overshadowed by unrest that quickly ravaged parts of cities from Pennsylvania to California. https://t.co/J5p5Yel3vG

text: RT @StacyStClair: Aurora police reporting officers were fired at tonight. name: chicagotribune
text: After a riotous Saturday night in Chicago, unrest over the death of George Floyd in Minneapolis again unfolded in the city and also in the suburbs on Sunday. https://t.co/BED8nvLeBv

name: chicagotribune
text: Sunday capped a tumultuous weekend that saw city and state officials across the nation deploy National Guard soldiers, enact strict curfews and shut down mass transit systems https://t.co/bMbpvhD1vM

name: chicagotribune
text: A tool touted as “a Chicago tenant’s best friend" is helping renters deal with their housing legal problems. https://t.co/e3OZ1nzDcH

text: RT @paigexfry: Violence last night was different than that of the day before. Previously, everything and everyone was focused on downtown and the high-end stores. Now that downtown was cutoff, people went to neighborhood stores all throughout the city: North, South and West. #ChicagoViolence last night was different than that of the day before. Previously, everything and everyone was focused on d… https://t.co/PnX4SLaIG3

name: chicagotribune
text: Chicago’s economic engine was expected to restart this week after being sidelined for months by the coronavirus pandemic. Instead, businesses spent Sunday sweeping up glass, boarding up windows and taking stock of destroyed stores and stolen inventory. https://t.co/xOiJqoGxD9

name: chicagotribune
text: CTA service has resumed across the city but access to the Loop and Chicago's central business district remained limited Monday morning https://t.co/Ts7tB5bqmm

name: chicagotribune
text:
Good morning, Chicago. Here are some top stories to start your day:
-Unrest spreads from Loop to neighborhoods and suburbs
-How a tense weekend in Chicago unfolded
-Downtown's iconic Central Camera vows to rebuild
https://t.co/fBAtJlQ6ji

name: chicagotribune
text: The state’s second largest city erupted into chaos Sunday night, as rioters looted stores and set a series of fires in downtown Aurora. https://t.co/9fO3iXZlzL

name: chicagotribune
text: Limited Loop access in Chicago, riots in Aurora and more fallout from unrest over the death of George Floyd https://t.co/8ex8ptAY8z

name: chicagotribune
text:
Mayor Lori Lightfoot doubled down on her comments about President Donald Trump last week, when she said her message to him “begins with F and it ends with U.”

“Anyone who is fomenting violence is doing wrong and we need to stand up united against that.” https://t.co/E1Qg12LML7

name: chicagotribune
text: Storefronts in downtown Aurora were boarded up and volunteers swept up broken glass Monday morning, after looting and clashes between protesters and police Sunday night https://t.co/WWceY678pf

name: chicagotribune
text:
Mayor Lori Lightfoot condemned looting in Chicago neighborhoods.

“Those small businesses sacrificed and saved money to have their dream realized, they hired employees from your neighborhood to serve you. ... That’s not the way. That is just not the way.” https://t.co/jEzyNDDIUc

name: chicagotribune
text:
We all have roles to play in the fight against injustice, writes Jahmal Cole, the CEO and founder of My Block, My Hood, My City.

We all have different agendas and tactics for how we address issues. These are the fundamentals of community organizing: https://t.co/OIdlh9jKd0

name: chicagotribune
text:
Chicago Public Schools has suspended its meal pickup service. In response, several local restaurants say they will offer free lunches to CPS families.

Here is a running list: https://t.co/YZ54uftZft

name: chicagotribune
text: Naperville has shut down its municipal center and alerted downtown businesses they should do the same as a precaution ahead of protests planned for Monday evening in Chicago's western suburbs https://t.co/09ZdmDNgyS

name: chicagotribune
text:
“If you’re someone who broke into the Nike store, you’d better make sure you wear those new Nikes when you attend the next city council meeting.”

Activist Jahmal Cole shares his fundamentals of community organizing: https://t.co/tFQYKEBz3e

name: chicagotribune
text: Illinois officials announced 974 new cases of COVID-19 on Monday, pushing the statewide total to 121,234 confirmed cases. Officials also reported 23 more deaths, bringing the death toll to 5,412. https://t.co/9zTTjAYjth

name: chicagotribune
text:
Protesters gathered in Waukegan this morning to re-emphasize their calls for an end to systemic police brutality.

“Black Lives Matter, we’re for ... all the protesting that you want to do. We do not promote looting or rioting. That is not in our mission.” https://t.co/pPRnTTqd7z

name: chicagotribune
text: An Illinois man arrested over the weekend had homemade bombs in his car and had been seen on videos looting and rioting in both Minneapolis and Chicago, federal authorities say. https://t.co/r2UnKVYo3R

name: chicagotribune
text: All of Chicago’s marijuana dispensaries have closed indefinitely to prevent or clean up from looting and vandalizing amid fallout from the death of George Floyd. https://t.co/9anGURD2GH

text: Gov. Pritzker is deploying about 250 Illinois National Guard troops to the suburbs following violent clashes on Sunday night. https://t.co/xsjejU5Diu

text: Cook County Sheriff Tom Dart delivered a two-pronged message on Monday: Peaceful protesters should carry on, but looters and vandals will find themselves in jail. https://t.co/nKFGd6kMAY
